Package com.continuuity.loom.admin

Admin definable entities.

See:
          Description

Class Summary
Administration Defines settings for cluster administration like lease duration, etc.
ClusterDefaults Default values for a cluster.
ClusterTemplate A cluster template defines different types of clusters that will be available for users to create.
Compatibilities Defines hardwaretypes, imagetypes, and services that a cluster is compatible with.
Constraints Constraints for how a cluster can be laid out.
HardwareType A hardware type defines some hardware that will be used when constructing a cluster, as well as a mapping to different providers and information needed by the provisioner to create the hardware for each provider, which should contain the provider specific flavor and any other information needed to create the hardware.
ImageType Image type defines different images to use on on clusters, and include information needed by provisioners to provision machines from different providers.
LayoutConstraint A Layout constraint specifies sets of services that must coexist on the same node, and sets of services that must not coexist on the same node in a cluster.
LeaseDuration Defines lease duration for a cluster.
NamedEntity A named entity has a name that must only consist of alphanumeric characters, underscore, period, and dash.
Provider Machine providers are instances of openstack, aws, rackspace, or joyent that can provision machines.
Service A service defines a set of services it is dependent on, as well as a mapping of ProvisionerAction to ServiceAction that provisioners will need to execute when performing cluster operations such as creation and deletion.
ServiceAction Actions that provisioners can execute on a service on a node.
ServiceConstraint Service constraints restrict what hardware and images are allowed for some service.
 

Enum Summary
Provider.Type Types of providers.
ProvisionerAction Type of provisioner actions.
 

Package com.continuuity.loom.admin Description

Admin definable entities.
